sen.j: 棟梁という言葉は今日では「大工の親方」という意味で用いられることが多いが、元は建物の屋根の主要部分である棟と梁を指していた。
sen.e: Although the term "toryo" (棟梁) generally refers to "master of craftsmen" at present, it originally referred to to (棟) (ridge) and ryo (梁) (a beam), the essential parts of building's ceiling.

sen.j: 棟と梁は建物の最も高い部分にあり、かつ重要な部分であるため、転じて国家などの組織の重要な人物を指し、また「頭領」・「統領」という表記も用いられた（『日本書紀』景行天皇51年（121年）条において武内宿禰を「棟梁之臣」と表現している）。
sen.e: Because to and ryo are situated at the top of building and were its essential parts, the term "toryo" became the one that refered to an important person of organization like a nation and was also written in Chines characters as "頭領" or "統領" (according to the description of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) for the 51st year of the Emperor Keiko (121), TAKENOUCHI no Sukune was described as "棟梁之臣" (Mune no machigimi) (a prime minister).

sen.j: 10世紀から11世紀にかけて、各地に「堪武芸之輩」・「武勇之人」と呼ばれる人々が現れて武門の源流となり、それを統率する人物を「武門之棟梁」と称した。
sen.e: In the 10th to 11th century, people called "tanbugei no hai"/"buyu no hito" (a person excelled in military art) became the origin of samurai families and a person who led such families was called "Bumon no toryo".

sen.j: 「武門之棟梁」は単一人とは限らなかったが、特に名声が高かったのは桓武平氏の平維時・平維衡・平致頼や清和源氏の源満仲・源頼光・源頼信らであった。
sen.e: Though "Bumon no toryo" was not necessarily a single person, persons who had particulary good reputaion were TAIRA no Koretoki, TAIRA no Korehira and TAIRA no Muneyori of Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) and MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka, MINAMOTO no Yorimitsu and MINAMOTO no Yorinobu of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: しかし、源頼朝が鎌倉幕府を開いて「天下兵馬之権」を掌握して武家政権を確立すると、清和源氏－河内源氏の血を引く人物が「武家の棟梁＝幕府の長・征夷大将軍」という図式が確立した。
sen.e: However, after Minamoto no Yoritomo seized "Tenka heiba no ken" (the power of commanding national military force) and established military government called Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), the scheme under which persons who originated from Seiwa-Genji/Kawachi-Genji became "Buke no toryo=the head of bakufu/Seii taishogun (great general who subdues the barbarians)" became established.

sen.j: 大和国の守護職を収めた興福寺の傘下にあった衆徒（大和武士）の指導者は幕府成立後も「棟梁」の地位を保ち、一乗院系の棟梁・筒井氏と大乗院系の棟梁・古市氏が互いに大和武士の指導者の地位を巡って争った。
sen.e: The leader of shuto (monk-soldiers) (Yamato bushi (samurai)) belonged to Kofuku-ji Temple, which was then the provincial governor of Yamato Province, maintained his position as "Toryo" even after the establishment of Kamakura bakufu and the Tsutsui clan, toryo of Ichijo-in Temple's shuto, and the Furuichi clan, toryo of Daijo-in Temple's shuto, competed each other for the status of the leader of Yamato bushi.
